website_summaries.verdict: The Volare has many of the same features as higher end models, but the emphasis is on weight reduction. Many parts are aluminum alloy, which makes it both strong and lightweight. Great for city commuters.
pros: Very strong braking system, can stop at any speed
Easy to assemble, and upgrades are available
cons: Specific assembly instructions not included, only generic owner's manual
Tires may not hold air, or may pop unexpectedly

customer_reviews.title: Good, but VERY unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I had this bike for a week, normal cycling around a small town, and the tire pops. Fixed, then 2 weeks later the axle snapped, sat in my closet for around 6 months. Fixed, greased, worked well for a week. Then the tire popped AGAIN. Also, the axle was bent. I PICK UP this bike over curbs, it's gone to the bike shop and I'm done with this bike. I would love this bike if the one I recieved didn't break every week. I am extremely disappointed in the quality of the bike. Edit: More road use, the axle broke again. This is ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Joseph Butzerin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ride and build.
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level bike. I hadnt road an actual bike for almost 18yrs but really got into Spin classes and wanted to try a road bike. Picked up this model and love it. I weighed it 27lbs. Assembly is easy but you will have to adjust the gears. Plenty of YouTube videos from Park tools will show you everything you need. I did swap out pedals for clip ins, and added some bars on the ends for additional riding stance. The seat is remarkably comfy. Pretty darn nice entry level bike. Good place to start if your unsure or just getting into cycling.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect commuter/leisure road bike.  Smooth and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bike for my son to ride to school. The item came in a Schwinn box, and was easily put together with the recommended tools indicated on the box and in the owner's manual. After completing the build, the bike proved to be smooth and fast. The bike looks great, and my son has received several compliments on it so far. The bike is fairly light weight, easy to transport on a roof or rear bike rack, and has quick release clips on the front and rear wheels, for easy removal and security. I am very pleased with the purchase, and have been satisfied with the quality, and attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddyKunk

customer_reviews.title: Bad Deraileur
customer_reviews.text: It would of earned 5 stars if only the rear assembly didn't make some strange clunk sound on 4th and 5th gear. The rear derailleur is loose overall and has shoddy rivets. I sound like a damn roller coaster climbing up the start of a ride. No amount of adjusting has fixed this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Crunch

customer_reviews.title: Smooth riding bike that's pretty fast and feels pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Smooth riding bike that's pretty fast and feels pretty sturdy. However, I had a pretty big issue with the front derailleur not adjusting with the barrel adjuster and high/low limit screws. I also had a recurring issue where the front crank would pop and cause the chain to slip and jerk anytime I put heavy pressure on the pedals. I brought it to the local bike shop and they said that they couldn't figure out what the problem was after attempting to adjust the front derailleur, swapping the chain and ensuring everything was tightened properly. If you get a bike that works properly it is probably pretty decent, but I think mine was defective.
customer_reviews.author: J_0697

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a cheap bike in pieces, but this thing is light and almost totally put together out of the box. Just had to add seat, pedals, and bars. I had five bikes stolen over the years and the recent one I lost was expensive. Decided to buy something cheap so I wouldn't lose so much when it was stolen. This bike is pretty good for what I do, which is ride around 30 miles a week low impact. It shifts great, rides great, I can pick it up with my index finger, and does what a town bike is supposed to do. I'd buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Aranhas

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn bicycle
customer_reviews.text: This is my second schwinn bike. It cost every penny you will spend (the price is also reasonable compared to other road bikes). The bike came in a box, and assembly took about 15 min. You will need to install the front wheel, the seat, and the handle bar. NOTE: front wheel is a quick release and does not require any tools for installation. It is relatively light weight, easy to change speeds. Love this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kazadi

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5' 9 and it fits great.
customer_reviews.text: 1st off I really like the look of this bike and at 5' 9 it fits me perfectly. Set up out of the box is minimal but it was obvious from the first ride that I'd need to get it in to a local bike shop for some fine tuning. Gear shifting is decent although there was front derailleur rubbing in the higher gears. Seat is hard as a rock so be prepared to invest in a replacement or at the least a seat cover. More than likely I wouldn't buy this bike again as my next will be an upgrade but I do plan on riding this one in to the ground 1st.
customer_reviews.author: Gary London

customer_reviews.title: not a Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: This bike is Schwinn in name only and does not meet the tradition of quality that the name implies. I returned mine and bought another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Watch for bent or broken parts...
customer_reviews.text: The metal piece where the chain goes through was bent and the bike would not ride properly. Accordingly - I spent $60 at a local bike store to replace the part and install. I don’t know how to ask for a partial refund so I’m just giving it a low review. Other than that the bike is great!
customer_reviews.author: Toughbutfair

customer_reviews.title: I had this bike for like 3 year since I purchased it from amazon
customer_reviews.text: I had this bike for like 3 year since I purchased it from amazon. I didn't pop the tire once during this time period. Many of the roads that ride on are absolutely horrible since it is New York. The bike definitely holds up to its quality and brand. I personally feel that this bike is kinda heavy to carry up stairs, just saying for those who lives on the 2 or 3 floor of a building.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife. She puts on about 25 miles every other day and every Sat. & Sunday. Great bike for the money... however we had to take it to a bike smith on day 2 because we couldn't figure out how to adjust the derailer thingy and rear shifter gears. No big deal, $15 later it was perfect and has been for the past few months. Its not a $2000 bike so don't expect $2000 bike performance. But its the best bike out there for this money.
customer_reviews.author: Riggs

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bike
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike. I wanted a good ride with reliable shifting for a decent price. I believe I got exactly that. I had a bike store put it together then switched out the seat and pedals for personal preference items.
customer_reviews.author: Ironman S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good entry level bike
customer_reviews.text: While this is certainly not a high end bike, it's not at the bottom either. I put it together myself (I'm a mechanic and a former avid biker) pretty easily. I did have to tweak it just a little to get it where I wanted it. The front wheel was very slightly out of true, no problem to fix that, I set the brake pads to where they really should have been and tweaked the rear derailleur just a tad for crisper shifts.
customer_reviews.author: THBinOKC

customer_reviews.title: I don’t like the product I want my money back for the Schwinn bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was defective but it’s not. It’s really hard to ride when your just used to a BMX bike or a one speed bike. The seat is not comfortable. The bike is also very delicate. Good bike for what it’s for but they have advanced a lot. I’m don’t like this bike. Want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Good entry-level bike for casual rider or student
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my adult son who resides in a different city than I do. There were problems with UPS that made the process more complicated than it had to be, but this has nothing to do with the quality of the bike. He said it was fairly easy to build and he likes the way it looks. He's not very tall - 5'9" and he states it is comfortable to ride. I can't comment on the quality since he hasn't owned it very long or ridden it very much. I will say that the quality of what we received was a good deal for the price I paid (around $220).
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Spend the extra $100 to get a decent bike.
customer_reviews.text: Mechanisms are poorly built, pieces are low quality, seat is hard, instructions are terrible, it was easier to ignore them. My bike came with a bent derailleur hanger, and Amazon required me to return the entire bike to get a new one. There is absolutely no way I would recommend this bike to anyone, even considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney G

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price point of $249
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price point of $249.00 and for my 12-year old son. I spent a little over $600.00 for my Giant Rapid 3 almost 5 years ago which has higher quality components and better build-quality. Materials are on the cheap side and bike makes too much noise when riding even after adjustments. Assembly was easy even though brakes need lots of adjustment to have it at the correct spacing. I bought it because my son insisted he would not ride his mountain bike anymore and wanted a hybrid, which I totally understand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great bike for me
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble . I am 6 feet tall with a 32 inch inseam and it fits right would not recommend for anyone with a smaller inseam
customer_reviews.author: Joel W Blanchfield

customer_reviews.title: Pedal broke off
customer_reviews.text: Pedal broke off after one week of use. Had to take to a bike shop to be fixed
customer_reviews.author: SiSamohamm

customer_reviews.title: High quality bike at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bike consistently for over a year now and it has been great! No issues whatsoever. High quality and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Easters

customer_reviews.title: Fun to ride
customer_reviews.text: I find it very good but seat is little unconfortable brakes makes noise some times gears work great
customer_reviews.author: deniz buyukacaroglu

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bike great price
customer_reviews.text: took my bike for a test drive yesturday, it is an awesome bike. Quick delivery and very easy to assembly. Very happy with this bike, but the handlebars are a little low. I'm hoping I would be able to rise them alittle. Love the bike
customer_reviews.author: ricardo c salazar

customer_reviews.title: I love wasting money
customer_reviews.text: Paid for assembly & came with a flat tire. Now they want to me disassemble the entire thing and ship it back & will not even cover the assembly again. Appreciate it amazon. I love wasting money.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Bad tire quality.
customer_reviews.text: Lame should have saw the red flags from other reviews before I bought this. I got my bike and after taking it for my first bike ride. The rear tire would not hold the air. It seems that the tube stem has a cut in it from where the rim is.. other than this, the bike it's self is good. .
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Melnichuk

customer_reviews.title: Nuce bike for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. I'm 6'2 and I thought it would be too short when it arrived but it's bee a smooyh, easy, and qyier ride. Good bike for the price!!! I ride about 15 miles for exercise and it's very good. Only suggestion is to get a different seat. This saddle is a little hard .
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this bike. I was under the impression that Schwinn was a reputable bike manufacturer. Perhaps not. My one complaint with the bike is that the materials (gears and such) are so cheap, the derailleur won't switch between the 1,2, and 3 gears. Other than that it's a normal cheapy bike. Honestly I've put way more into it than I purchased it for and I wish I would've spent a few hundred more dollars and got something nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Good road bike and value for money. Most of it was assembled. I had to fix only seat, peddles and adjust breaks. Had to tune de-railer as well as gears were slipping. Could finish entire assembly within half an hour.
customer_reviews.author: rags

customer_reviews.title: This bike is really nice for a city
customer_reviews.text: This bike is really nice for a city. It is light in weight, comfortable and it can go very fast. Even that the speeds were "calibrated" from fabric, mys were not working really well, mainly in steep rises, but it was matter of readjusting the speeds, now seems fine. Apart from that it's working perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Camila Pulido

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Handling and maneuvering is in point for me being tall. The bike is an excellent fit.
customer_reviews.author: Don Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Rear tire tube
customer_reviews.text: Took about an hour to assemble the bike and found out that I couldn't pump air on the rear tire due to defective tube.
customer_reviews.author: Cool tops

customer_reviews.title: bike is too small for my 6'3 in frame
customer_reviews.text: its just too small i want to return this bike but im not getting any replies on where i return the bike ASAP tell me where the bike needs to be returned
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: great bike
customer_reviews.text: told it was pretty easy to assemble and rides well.
customer_reviews.author: ecw

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike
customer_reviews.text: Got this one for my girlfriend,it’s been two years now,now issues runs great,sturdy and light.
customer_reviews.author: Maksimdz

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is about as good a bike as you can get
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is about as good a bike as you can get. No complaints after riding it for about 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Nemo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is easy to put together, works really good. I have been using it for three months and I so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa F.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend to anyone starting a new hobby or not looking to spend thousands
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. My first real bike to help me start getting fit and active. I love it, especially after seeing how expensive some of these bikes can be.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Souto

customer_reviews.title: WRONG COLOR
customer_reviews.text: Ad said bike is blue. Box it arrived in said bike is blue. Looking at bike. Bike is green. Lime green is NOT BLUE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price. I am using to to tool around on the paths and take my son in his carriage. I did take it to a professional bike shop to have it assembled and tired trued. TOTALLY worth the extra expense considering how low cost the bike it. I have recommended this to several people as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sensational Bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular bike all I did was change the seat and add a bracket for a water bottle. Ive put around 50 miles on it and Ive only had it two days
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: After one month right foot pedal broke off
customer_reviews.text: Instructions to put together were very confusing. After one month right foot pedal broke off and now not sure who to contact to fix
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: A good bicycle, especially when you consider the price (mid two hundreds at the time of this writing). Is it perfect? No. As others have mentioned, the seat is hard, and perhaps the cassette isn't top quality, and it isn't as light as I would have liked, but remember the price of this bicycle. I bought it three months ago and my butt has gotten used to the hardness of the seat. It could always be replaced with another softer one for just $15 or so. Do I have buyer's remorse? No, not at all. Quite the opposite, I would buy it again, and would even recommend it to friends and relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Parker

customer_reviews.title: tire blew out three times
customer_reviews.text: my tube popped and when i replacd it, it popped again and the same thing happened a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Azriel B.

customer_reviews.title: Its a cheap bike with some good parts provided here and there
customer_reviews.text: Its a cheap bike with some good parts provided here and there. Paint on the handlebars is awful and can be fade away easily by minor scratches. Overall bike is also not stable and you need to index and tune the gears to make use of all 21 gears. So if you have more money get better bike instead of this.
customer_reviews.author: Aditya

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bike. Required little assembly and only adjustment was to the break pad toe in.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It would have been nicer if I had the owners ...
customer_reviews.text: It would have been nicer if I had the owners manual for this bike and not for a girls bike.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L Santomenno

customer_reviews.title: Love the bike, needs minor tweaks
customer_reviews.text: I love the bicycle, though the gears had to be adjusted to avoid friction between the chain and the gear mover at the highest and lowest configuration. Tires are good, but I wish they could retain air better. I have reached 40km/hr with this bike, which is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: ChinchillaNest

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with hole in inner tube.
customer_reviews.text: Bike came with a leak in the front tire’s inner tube.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Carol
customer_reviews.text: Really great bike. Just getting back into riding again and it's a perfect fit for me..
customer_reviews.author: carol e.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike! The front brake had to be adjusted, but other than that it is great! I am new the these bikes so I am at a lost to why the seats are designed so hard! Rides nice except for that seat! I ordered the Bell Memory Foam Saddle, Recline 800 from Amazon to replace this terrrible seat. The bike is still worth the money, but I would HIGHLY suggest you get that Bell Memory Foam Saddle! You will not regret it! Bike will still get 5 stars from me because its a great bike and it looks and performs like the expensive ones, but without the price!
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price. You do need to take it up for a tune-up, but a great by otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Camps

customer_reviews.title: Front derailleur making so much noice
customer_reviews.text: I tried aligning front derailleur default settings to reduce the noice. But still it didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Chetan

customer_reviews.title: Great Bicycle for the price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted... Except it was stolen 11 Days after I got it... Gonna order another one as soon as I can...
customer_reviews.author: Conway814

customer_reviews.title: ... bike for my son for his birthday and he loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my son for his birthday and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: SO57

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble. Rides great after just a little tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence

customer_reviews.title: Too Small For 6 footers, But a Good Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is my first road bike. I'm impressed, and I imagine if you're willing to pay up to a thousand on a bicycle, it must be pretty frickin' awesome. Putting the bike together was...pretty easy - even better if you actually know how to make bike adjustments. (I spent time on YouTube, and it works, but I know a trip to a professional is pending.) I'm around 6'3", and this bike is probably a little small for me, but I added a stem raiser (for the handlebars) and have been able to make it work, until I'm ready to purchase a more expensive bike with a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lenoir

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bike. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This bike is worth so much more money! It rides terrific. Been using it around Brooklyn for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Katz

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Everything is cheap and starts breaking slowly over 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Yossef Y. Teleshevsky

customer_reviews.title: Bad components, this bike will come broken
customer_reviews.text: The bike looks sleek, but it is simply manufactured with bad parts. It's pretty much a certainty that you will recieve this bike with bad bearings and a bad freewheel, and the bike will basically be unridable upon assembly, with a terrible knocking sound with every turn of the pedals. I can't recommend a bike that arrives broken and requires the purchasing of new parts and an immediate visit to a local bike shop (if you arent technically skilled with bike repair) upon purchase. This is a broken product. Invest in a quality bike that will come with original quality components.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike I've ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: As much as I loved my Trek hybrid I love this bike even more and it was about half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Troy A Lasseigne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for bike
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for bike, added Delta stem riser (wrist issues), Sunlite toe clips and a Cloud 9 saddle. Senior citizen who rides 25 miles/week.
customer_reviews.author: Semore

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike, overall. I actually exchanged it with another one of the same model as the initial one had a bent rear wheel. (Packing it was not a breeze...) It took some time for me to adjust the gears and it seems to me that the tires do not hold the air, so I have to inflate them quite often. Light bike and great size for me at 6.1. The handle bar is a bit uncomfortable -I will look to change it- and I changed the seat as the one that came with the bike is as hard as a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Catalin Vieru

customer_reviews.title: You will need to buy a more comfortable seat.
customer_reviews.text: The seat is very uncomfortable!! I could only ride it once with the seat and then I had to buy a new one. I was sore for days.
customer_reviews.author: Mightandmagic6

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and relatively quality built bike given its price
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and relatively quality built bike given its price. I like the bike and recommend it. 1 star goes off for the following: The handlebar is short and not adjustable, I am 5'10 and I have to lean really forward to reach it. Front brake pads always touch the wheel whether you use it or not, they dont retreat back properly. I tried to do some adjustments, still they don't retreat properly. Overall, given its price point, I recommend this bike as a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: The Texan

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bike. He has used it for a whole semester and it has held up nicely even though he is having to keep it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Irma L.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this bike to ride to work everyday. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike to ride to work everyday. I probably biked around 4 miles everyday and everything was to my satisfaction until I started having issues with my pedal 5 weeks later. I began riding my bike and noticed my left pedal was loose. The pedal eventually fell off while I was biking and cannot be put back on. The threading in the pedal looks stripped. I contacted Pacific Cycle to obtain parts through their limited warranty and I have yet to get a response 1 week later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not full of hot air!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy. Received bike 10/13/16 opened box started to unpack and noticed rear tire is flat. Put the rest of it together not hard took about 30min. Tried to air tire and could hear air leaking around the rim. Called Pacific Cycle they will send a tube free of charge 3-10 business days but now I have to pay someone to put the tube in and they do not pay for that what a joke. Paid over $200 and still can't ride my new bike. I will update my review after I get the bike on the road. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Steve Z.

customer_reviews.title: Tire punctured in a day and seat hurts like hell. But its definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Tire punctured in a day and seat hurts like hell. But its definitely worth the price, just wish i was willing to put at-least 100 more into a better bike
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Ghumman

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike - easy to put together and far better than others in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Just saying....

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a solid bike overall. The instructions were a bit hard to follow because they aren't written for this bike in particular, but rather a guide to assembling Schwinn bikes of all kinds. I'm not sure what it is, but the bike also makes a loud clank sound when the right pedal reaches a certain point in its rotation. I'll likely take it into a shop soon to have it looked at. The seat is also terrible. It has to be replaced fairly soon because it's so uncomfortable. But they have to skimp somewhere to make it so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Southwick

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, but great as an intro bike for casual bikers
customer_reviews.text: Good price but the quality of the bike isn't fantastic. The gears don't switch easily, and I've even had the chain pop off a few times but that was partially my fault. It's squeaking pretty badly now and I don't know where from. The assembly was not hard at all, the price is great, but the overall quality is pretty shoddy. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel James Knight

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bike!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bike!!! Rides very fast and smooth. Having problems getting the seat off to replace, if you could comment on specific tools you used, that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: this game is fun and sometimes boring

customer_reviews.title: Day 3: Repairs needed.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this bike. However today riding home one pedal fell out. Apparently it become slightly lose and just bored a hole into the pedal assembly, pedal assembly is wrecked, pedal questionable. Guess you get what you get for the price... expect maintenance...
customer_reviews.author: Eric M.

customer_reviews.title: Wheels need trueing
customer_reviews.text: Bike seems good, but arrived with the wheels out of true, which was an additional expense
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Great bike! However
customer_reviews.text: Great bike! However, I am 6'0" and it seems a bit short for me. It's not the seller's fault or the manufacturer. It's a learning experience for me. this bike is meant more for those who are about 5'8".
customer_reviews.author: AB84

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really light and nice performance on road. There maybe some problem with the shifter. Assembling is easy.
customer_reviews.author: John Han

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, easy to put together however I am going to a bike shop to get the gears adjusted for best performance. Great value
customer_reviews.author: john a robinson

customer_reviews.title: The bike is really nice.. Easy to unpack and install
customer_reviews.text: The bike is really nice.. Easy to unpack and install. This is my first road bike. I am liking it.
customer_reviews.author: Jagadeesh N

customer_reviews.title: Good entry lever bike
customer_reviews.text: I received bike yesterday. It easy to assemble took me 20 minutes. Made some adjustment and rode my first 4-5 miles. Easy shifting, smooth ride, good brakes. Bike feels solid and looks good. It weight about 30 lbs. Good for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Serge K

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Product shipped as described. Great bike for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, light bike, gear works very smoothly,
customer_reviews.author: saeid

customer_reviews.title: smooth shifting and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Did the 44miles NYC Bike tour effortless..smooth shifting and comfortable ride
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Loved this bike
customer_reviews.text: Loved this bike, got stolen 3 weeks after I bought it :( -1 because it seemed pretty fragile, but again that could just be me. It's a nice looking bike too! (I didnt have it long enough to see it age though :p)
customer_reviews.author: Oussama

customer_reviews.title: Will need to be wary of the front derailleur !
customer_reviews.text: I had the bike shop adjust the derailleurs (3 times), the front continues to be a problem. I'm still unable to get it tuned properly so that the front gears shift in the proper order and time. If purchasing this bike be prepared to put in an additional amount of money to get it working smooth and properly. The rear Shimano works great, but the front is garbage. I have had the bike about 3 weeks and will already have to upgrade parts that shouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: P. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly. Some parts can be faulty.
customer_reviews.text: It came with a flat tire. The valve joint had a fault (see picture). Otherwise, a great budget bike! I also recommend replacing the stock seat with a bigger one for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light which is perfect for carrying up my 4 flight walkup apartment
customer_reviews.text: Very light which is perfect for carrying up my 4 flight walkup apartment.. Road bike wheels are a bit thin/fragile for NYC biking but a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The package came damaged, it appeared that someone had ...
customer_reviews.text: The package came damaged, it appeared that someone had bought this item and just threw it back in the box, and there was no quality inspection to see if anything was damaged or broke. The Derailleurs, was sheared in half the front tire was totally scuffed, there was no directions on how to assemble this bicycle, just some generic Schwinn owners manual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent bike; had difficulty adjusting the front derailers but may be my experience
customer_reviews.author: david urech

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This bike has had issues since it arrived to the house.
customer_reviews.author: zose

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the cost! I ride it a lot on the bike trails in Atlanta. No real issues, I was looking for something affordable that didn't suck and looked good that would ride well in the city. Also I like straight handle bars like a mountain bike and this fits the bill. You can always upgrade parts as needed (I upgraded the seat). The frame is what matters and it is light enough and solid. Came in a big box half put together. Takes 30 minutes with basic tools and a bike pump and you are out the door!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Azar Mize

customer_reviews.title: It rides really well but when I was filling the ...
customer_reviews.text: It rides really well but when I was filling the tire with air it popped. it was supposed to be filled up to 100 psi didn't even get past 60 before it popped now I have to get another tube and replace it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Perfect deal! !
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for riding around town. So happy with the purchase! !!
customer_reviews.author: disc golf lover

customer_reviews.title: Tired don't hold up, brakes sticking after two month
customer_reviews.text: A thorn punctured the tire in the first month of use, a month later a thorn punctured the other tire. Both front and back brakes are now sticking.
customer_reviews.author: A. johnson

customer_reviews.title: Front tire tube faulty
customer_reviews.text: Bicycle seems nice however my front tire will not inflate. After some inspection it sends to have shipped with a fault tube in the front tire.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: you need to know how to fix bikes and few parts like brakes need to be exchanged very soon after purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, we ordered three of them for our delivery service. They do their job, you need to know how to fix bikes and few parts like brakes need to be exchanged very soon after purchase (we do use it all day everyday). One of them came with a damaged tire already, we sent it back and got a new one within 2 days, 2/3 were packaged different then the broken one. We attached a Heavy Duty Cargo Rack to it which works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control
customer_reviews.text: After 3 rides the back tube seemed to not keep pressure, no big deal thought I would replace it. Turns out the wheel was pinched around the valve, making it almost impossible to remove the old tube, and absolutely impossible to install the new tube without tearing it to shreds. Terrible quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Bland

customer_reviews.title: It came with a wrong manual! I spent 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: It came with a wrong manual! I spent 3 hrs to assemble it by myself then find the the front wheel flat! I tried to ass air to it but it remains as it is. I am not a bike expert and suspected the wheel may be defected so just returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: she was not very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, she was not very happy with it. Mostly it was too long for her. She traded out the seat.
customer_reviews.author: natashia McMullin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Received the completely wrong bike. I received a schwinn high timber. Completely ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Schwinn Volare Adult Hybrid Road Bike, 28-inch Wheel, Aluminum Frame, Multiple Colors
feature_bullets: Road bike with aluminum rigid fitness frame and rigid fork. Flat styled handlebar and sport riding seat.
21 speeds, Shimano rear derailleur and EZ Fire shifters. Have confidence that you are riding with the world's largest manufacturer of bike components.
The alloy linear pull brakes on the front and rear mean that stopping won't be an issue and the alloy wheels with high profile rims have a look great
Aluminum frame, alloy wheels, alloy crank, alloy brakes and Shimano components. A great deal that will get you out there riding and feeling more fit
Like all Schwinn bikes the Volar 1200 comes with limited lifetime for as long as you own the bike.
